intro: Boehmeria maximowiczii, commonly known as giant mulberry, is a flowering plant species native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and its fibers are used in traditional textiles. Boehmeria maximowiczii is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks.
